bugs.title: CVE-2024-27834 webkit2gtk4.0: webkit: pointer authentication bypass [fedora-rawhide]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2024-27834 webkit2gtk4.0: webkit: pointer authentication bypass [fedora-rawhide]

long_desc.thetext:
An attacker with arbitrary read and write capability may be able to bypass Pointer Authentication. Description: The issue was addressed with improved checks.
    
WebKit Bugzilla: 272750

Versions affected: WebKitGTK and WPE WebKit before 2.44.2.

Created webkit2gtk4.0 tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-rawhide [bug 2282416]


Created webkitgtk tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-39 [bug 2282414]
Affects: fedora-40 [bug 2282415]
Reference: https://webkitgtk.org/security/WSA-2024-0003.html

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2282412

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# low, medium, high, urgent (required)
severity=high

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=2282412,2282416

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new

FEDORA-2024-1f1c0537d3 (webkit2gtk4.0-2.44.3-2.fc40) has been submitted as an update to Fedora 40.
https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2024-1f1c0537d3

FEDORA-2024-1f1c0537d3 has been pushed to the Fedora 40 testing repository.
Soon you'll be able to install the update with the following command:
`sudo dnf upgrade --enablerepo=updates-testing --refresh --advisory=FEDORA-2024-1f1c0537d3`
You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2024-1f1c0537d3

See also https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for more information on how to test updates.

FEDORA-2024-1f1c0537d3 (webkit2gtk4.0-2.44.3-2.fc40) has been pushed to the Fedora 40 stable repository.

bugs.title: CVE-2024-40776 webkit2gtk4.0: Use after free may lead to Remote Code Execution [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2024-40776 webkit2gtk4.0: Use after free may lead to Remote Code Execution [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2024-40776 webkitgtk: webkit2gtk: Use after free may lead to Remote Code Execution

long_desc.thetext: A use-after-free issue was addressed with improved memory management.
Fixed by https://github.com/WebKit/WebKit/commit/b951404ea74ae432312a83138f5c8945a0d09e1b
("Always copy all audio channels to the AudioBus to guarantee data lifetime.")

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9

Via RHSA-2024:8180 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2024:8180

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9.2 Extended Update Support

Via RHSA-2024:8492 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2024:8492

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9.0 Update Services for SAP Solutions

Via RHSA-2024:8496 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2024:8496

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2301841

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

bugs.title: CVE-2024-40782 webkit2gtk4.0: Use after free may lead to Remote Code Execution [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2024-40782 webkit2gtk4.0: Use after free may lead to Remote Code Execution [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2024-40782 webkitgtk: webkit2gtk: Use-after-free was addressed with improved memory management

long_desc.thetext:
Description: A use-after-free issue was addressed with improved memory management.

Impact: Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to an unexpected process crash.
Fixed by https://github.com/WebKit/WebKit/commit/c2f9092d3a8e7bf63dd1c55c9917cd391fff2665 (Nullptr crash due to display:block ruby and continuations)

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9

Via RHSA-2024:8180 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2024:8180

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9.2 Extended Update Support

Via RHSA-2024:8492 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2024:8492

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9.0 Update Services for SAP Solutions

Via RHSA-2024:8496 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2024:8496

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2302071

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

bugs.title: CVE-2024-40780 webkit2gtk4.0: Out-of-bounds read was addressed with improved bounds checking [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2024-40780 webkit2gtk4.0: Out-of-bounds read was addressed with improved bounds checking [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2024-40780 webkitgtk: webkit2gtk: Out-of-bounds read was addressed with improved bounds checking

long_desc.thetext:
Description: An out-of-bounds read was addressed with improved bounds checking.

Impact: Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to an unexpected process crash.
Fixed by https://github.com/WebKit/WebKit/commit/e83e4c7460972898dc06a5f5ab36eed7c6b101b5 (HeapBufferOverflow in computeSampleUsingLinearInterpolation)

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9

Via RHSA-2024:8180 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2024:8180

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9.2 Extended Update Support

Via RHSA-2024:8492 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2024:8492

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9.0 Update Services for SAP Solutions

Via RHSA-2024:8496 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2024:8496

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2302069

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2024-40789 webkitgtk: webkit2gtk: Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to an unexpected process crash

long_desc.thetext:
Description: An out-of-bounds access issue was addressed with improved bounds checking.

Impact: Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to an unexpected process crash.
Fixed by https://github.com/WebKit/WebKit/commit/5086d3e6dcdc75da81c0eab8cd9318cff13e63f8 (WebCodecs VideoFrame Out-Of-Bounds Read)

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9
